title: My Event
subTitle: Web application to create and join events via OAuth2.
description: My Event allows users to create, join and view events near their location. Registration and login are done exclusively via Google or GitHub. Events are displayed on a map and data validation is handled with Zod.

title: Driving School
subTitle: Internal management application for a driving school.
description: This project is an internal application developed with Django, allowing management of students, instructors and administrators of a driving school. Students can access an online code, book driving lessons with their assigned instructor, and track their progress. Instructors can add new students, validate lessons, while administrators manage the entire platform, create code courses and supervise the organization.

title: Beta Series
subTitle: Web application to track and share your TV series with friends.
description: Beta Series allows users to connect their BetaSeries account to track the series they watch and share their progress with friends. The interface is entirely built with Vue.js and TailwindCSS.

title: Chat-IRC
subTitle: Real-time chat application inspired by Slack and Discord
description: Chat-IRC allows creating and joining channels, sending private messages, moderating channels and interacting live thanks to Socket.io. The front-end is in React with TailwindCSS and the back-end in Node.js with Sequelize and SQLite3.

title: PhaserJs - 2D Internship Search Game
subTitle: A 2D video game gamifying the search for an internship
description: Project created with Phaser.js to develop a 2D video game on the theme of internship search. The player can choose between 3 characters with different skills, go through several scenes with dialogues and interview battles, face recruiter NPCs asking technical questions, and experience different endings based on their choices and successes. The game includes an immersive soundtrack, scripted dialogues, as well as a multiple endings system ranging from failure (endgame if too many interviews fail) to success (happy ending with contract signing).

title: My Portfolio
subTitle: A modern portfolio built with Nuxt.js and TailwindCSS
description: This project is my personal portfolio, developed with Nuxt.js, TailwindCSS and NuxtUI for some components. It allows presenting my projects, skills and journey in a clear and modern way, with a responsive and elegant interface. The goal is to showcase my work as a full-stack developer, while offering smooth and intuitive navigation.

title: Reborn Slayer
subTitle: An immersive 3D video game built with Ruby on Rails and Three.js
description: Reborn Slayer is a 3D video game where the player chooses a character to live an adventure filled with quests, battles against NPCs and creatures, and resource management. The game offers a complete inventory, virtual currency and a shop to buy items. Developed with Ruby on Rails for business logic and Three.js for the 3D universe, it provides an interactive and immersive experience.

title: The Chef's Truck
subTitle: A showcase website and admin panel for a food truck
description: This project is a website built with Symfony using Twig and Tailwind, hosted on a VPS. On the public side, it allows customers to discover the food truck's history, browse the updated menu, view events, opening hours and contact the owner. On the administration side, a complete dashboard allows easy content management: adding and modifying menus, updating schedules, managing opening locations, as well as modifying photos and events. The whole offers a turnkey, modern and responsive solution for a food truck based in the south of France.

title: Symfony 7.3 REST API Boilerplate
subTitle: A complete and modern boilerplate to quickly start a secure REST API
description: This project is a boilerplate built with Symfony 7.3, designed to create robust, secure and ready-to-use REST APIs. It includes registration, JWT login, email validation, password reset, as well as a rate limiter system to protect against brute force attacks. Email sending is handled asynchronously thanks to Messenger and Mailer. The project follows SOLID best practices, uses EventSubscriber for event logic, and integrates Monolog to trace logs of different actions. The whole is documented and delivered with unit and functional tests, as well as ready-to-use scenarios in BRUNO. The development environment is provided via Docker Compose, including PostgreSQL, Adminer and Caddy with FrankenPHP to replace PHP-FPM (better performance and compatibility with Mercure for future real-time notifications). For production, the boilerplate includes Grafana for monitoring and can be deployed with Docker Swarm (additional configuration required).

title: End of Year Project - Mobalpa Marseille
subTitle: Development of a showcase e-commerce website and administrator for Mobalpa Marseille
description: As part of the end-of-first-year project at Epitech, in partnership with Mobalpa Marseille, our team of 4 students designed and developed a complete website in 6 effective weeks. The project included a showcase e-commerce site allowing customers to browse and quickly filter appliances, furnished rooms (bedrooms, bathrooms, dressing rooms...), as well as an interactive map to locate stores, a contact page and a section tracing the company's history. On the administrator side, a complete panel allowed managing orders, payments, promotions and site content. The project required significant technical and organizational preparation work: research and integration of product visuals, creation of all data, role distribution and implementation of collaborative best practices. Built with React and Tailwind for the front-end and Symfony as REST API for the back-end.
